identified-content.person: CAMPBELL, CAMILLE ROGERS (CAMILLE ROGERS VON ARNIM)

block.p: Camille Rogers Campbell, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel R. Campbell of Southampton, L.I., was married there last evening to Count Joachim von Arnim, a son of Count Adolf-Heinrich von Arnim-Boitzenburg of Schlossborn, Germany, and Countess Maria von Arnim of Munich, Germany. The Rev. Peter M. Larsen performed the Episcopal ceremony at St. Andrew's Dune Church.

Countess Camille von Arnim was until recently a public affairs coordinator for the New York Zoological Society in New York. She graduated from Denison University. Her father, who is retired, was the president of Personal Economics Group, a New York financial-services company.

Camille Rogers Campbell, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel R. Campbell of Southampton, L.I., was married there last evening to Count Joachim von Arnim, a son of Count Adolf-Heinrich von Arnim-Boitzenburg of Schlossborn, Germany, and Countess Maria von Arnim of Munich, Germany. The Rev. Peter M. Larsen performed the Episcopal ceremony at St. Andrew's Dune Church.

Countess Camille von Arnim was until recently a public affairs coordinator for the New York Zoological Society in New York. She graduated from Denison University. Her father, who is retired, was the president of Personal Economics Group, a New York financial-services company.

Count von Arnim is a vice president in the corporate strategy department of Deutsche Bank in Frankfurt. He received a B.S. degree from the St. Gall Graduate School of Business in St. Gall, Switzerland, and an M.B.A. from Babson College. His father, who is retired, was a director of Henkell & Sohnlein Sektkellereien K.G., a wine producer in Wiesbaden, Germany. The bridegroom is a grandson of the late Dr. Carl Henschel, who was the owner of the Henschel Locomotive Company in Kassel, Germany.
